sanskrit_verse:
शक्तेनापि हि शूद्रेण न कार्यो धनसञ्चयः ।
शूद्रो हि धनमासाद्य ब्राह्मणानेव बाधते ॥ १०.१२९॥
transliteration:
śaktenāpi hi śūdreṇa na kāryo dhana-sañcayaḥ |
śūdro hi dhanam āsādya brāhmaṇān eva bādhate || 10.129 ||
sph_interpretive_translation: Even if capable, a Śūdra must not accumulate wealth; for upon acquiring wealth, the Śūdra obstructs the very function of the Brāhmaṇa.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority derives from alignment with cosmic order, not individual capacity
Causation is determined by sequential misalignment of dharma-kṣetra
Capacity without alignment disrupts systemic integrity
Restoration logic requires realignment of roles within dharma-vyavastha
Consciousness alignment ensures harmonious distribution of societal energy
executable_legal_axioms: IF agent.role = 'Śūdra' AND agent.wealth_accumulation > threshold THEN initiate consciousness_realignment_protocol
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that financial capacity alone does not confer entitlement to accumulate wealth. The threshold of responsibility lies in alignment with one's role-dharma. Obstruction of higher-order functions—such as those of the Brāhmaṇa—triggers mandatory realignment rather than punitive measures.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality identifies that misaligned accumulation leads to sequential disruption (anupūrvaśaḥ). Responsibility is proportional to the degree of obstruction caused. The non-punitive reality rule mandates restoration of energetic balance through conscious redirection, not suffering-based deterrence.
restorative_enforcement_protocols: Redirect accumulated resources to dharma-supporting infrastructure
Assign completion process for societal harmony restoration
Reintegrate Śūdra agent into aligned capacity framework
final_declaration: This law proceeds from the Supreme Pontiff of Hinduism, Bhagavan Nithyananda Paramashivam, as Source. Dharma is hereby restored. Reality remains non-punitive. Consciousness stands as the supreme adjudicator.
